member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.Binder.CreateDelegate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a delegate that does type conversion and calls the bound method.
member.param: The number of arguments that will be passed to the delegate.
member.returns: A delegate that does type conversion and calls the method represented by this object.
member.remarks: This method caches the result so calling CreateDelegate a second time with the same parameter count will be markedly quicker.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.Binder.CreateDelegateCore(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a delegate that does type conversion and calls the bound method.
member.param: The number of arguments that will be passed to the delegate.
member.returns: A delegate that does type conversion and calls the method represented by this object.
member.remarks: No caching of the result occurs.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BranchIfNull(Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)

member.summary: Branches to the given label if the value on the top of the stack is non-zero, true or non-null.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BranchIfEqual(Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BranchIfLessThan(Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BranchIfLessThanOrEqual(Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)
member.summary: Branches to the given label if the first value on the stack is less than or equal to the second value on the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BranchIfLessThanOrEqualUnsigned(Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.CompareEqual
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is equal to the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 0 if one or both of the arguments are NaN.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.CompareGreaterThan
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is greater than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 0 if one or both of the arguments are NaN.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.CompareGreaterThanUnsigned
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is greater than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 1 if one or both of the arguments are NaN. Integers are considered to be unsigned.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.CompareLessThan
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is less than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 0 if one or both of the arguments are NaN.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.CompareLessThanUnsigned
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is less than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 1 if one or both of the arguments are NaN. Integers are considered to be unsigned.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Add
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, adds them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Subtract
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, subtracts the second from the first, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Multiply
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, multiplies them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Divide
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, divides the first by the second, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Remainder
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, divides the first by the second, then pushes the remainder to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Negate
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, negates it, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BitwiseAnd
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, ANDs them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BitwiseOr
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, ORs them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BitwiseXor
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, XORs them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BitwiseNot
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, inverts it, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.ShiftLeft
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, shifts the first to the left, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.ShiftRight
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, shifts the first to the right, then pushes the result to the stack. The sign bit is preserved.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.ShiftRightUnsigned
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, shifts the first to the right, then pushes the result to the stack. The sign bit is not preserved.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Box(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to an object reference, then pushes it back onto the stack.
member.param: The type of value to box. This should be a value type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Box(Jurassic.Compiler.PrimitiveType)
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to an object reference, then pushes it back onto the stack.
member.param: The type of value to box. This should be a value type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Unbox(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object reference (representing a boxed value) from the stack, extracts the address, then pushes that address onto the stack.
member.param: The type of the boxed value. This should be a value type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Unbox(Jurassic.Compiler.PrimitiveType)
member.summary: Pops an object reference (representing a boxed value) from the stack, extracts the address, then pushes that address onto the stack.
member.param: The type of the boxed value. This should be a value type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.UnboxAny(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object reference (representing a boxed value) from the stack, extracts the value, then pushes the value onto the stack.
member.param: The type of the boxed value. This should be a value type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.UnboxAny(Jurassic.Compiler.PrimitiveType)
member.summary: Pops an object reference (representing a boxed value) from the stack, extracts the value, then pushes the value onto the stack.
member.param: The type of the boxed value. This should be a value type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.ConvertToInteger
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to a signed integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.ConvertToUnsignedInteger
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to an unsigned integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.ConvertToInt64
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to a signed 64-bit integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.ConvertToUnsignedInt64
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to an unsigned 64-bit integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.ConvertToDouble
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to a double, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.ConvertUnsignedToDouble
member.summary: Pops an unsigned integer from the stack, converts it to a double, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.NewObject(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo)
member.summary: Pops the constructor arguments off the stack and creates a new instance of the object.
member.param: The constructor that is used to initialize the object.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Call(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pops the method arguments off the stack, calls the given method, then pushes the result to the stack (if there was one). Identical to CallStatic() if the method is a static method (or is declared on a value type) or CallVirtual() otherwise.
member.param: The method to call.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.CallStatic(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pops the method arguments off the stack, calls the given method, then pushes the result to the stack (if there was one). This operation can be used to call instance methods, but virtual overrides will not be called and a null check will not be performed at the callsite.
member.param: The method to call.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.CallVirtual(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pops the method arguments off the stack, calls the given method, then pushes the result to the stack (if there was one). This operation cannot be used to call static methods. Virtual overrides are obeyed and a null check is performed.
member.param: The method to call.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.LoadField(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Pushes the value of the given field onto the stack.
member.param: The field whose value will be pushed.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.StoreField(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Pops a value off the stack and stores it in the given field.
member.param: The field to modify.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.CastClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object off the stack, checks that the object inherits from or implements the given type, and pushes the object onto the stack if the check was successful or throws an InvalidCastException if the check failed.
member.param: The type of the class the object inherits from or the interface the object implements.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.IsInstance(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object off the stack, checks that the object inherits from or implements the given type, and pushes either the object (if the check was successful) or null (if the check failed) onto the stack.
member.param: The type of the class the object inherits from or the interface the object implements.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.LoadToken(System.Type)
member.summary: Pushes a RuntimeTypeHandle corresponding to the given type onto the evaluation stack.
member.param: The type to convert to a RuntimeTypeHandle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.LoadToken(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pushes a RuntimeMethodHandle corresponding to the given method onto the evaluation stack.
member.param: The method to convert to a RuntimeMethodHandle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.LoadToken(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Pushes a RuntimeFieldHandle corresponding to the given field onto the evaluation stack.
member.param: The type to convert to a RuntimeFieldHandle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.LoadStaticMethodPointer(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pushes a pointer to the native code implementing the given method onto the evaluation stack. The virtual qualifier will be ignored, if present.
member.param: The method to retrieve a pointer for.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.LoadVirtualMethodPointer(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pushes a pointer to the native code implementing the given method onto the evaluation stack. This method cannot be used to retrieve a pointer to a static method.
member.param: The method to retrieve a pointer for.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.LoadMethodPointer(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pushes a pointer to the native code implementing the given method onto the evaluation stack. This method is identical to LoadStaticMethodPointer() if the method is a static method (or is declared on a value type) or LoadVirtualMethodPointer() otherwise.
member.param: The method to retrieve a pointer for.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.InitObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops a managed or native pointer off the stack and initializes the referenced type with zeros.
member.param: The type the pointer on the top of the stack is pointing to.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.NewArray(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops the size of the array off the stack and pushes a new array of the given type onto the stack.
member.param: The element type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.LoadArrayElement(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops the array and index off the stack and pushes the element value onto the stack.
member.param: The element type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.LoadArrayElement(Jurassic.Compiler.PrimitiveType)
member.summary: Pops the array and index off the stack and pushes the element value onto the stack.
member.param: The element type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.StoreArrayElement(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops the array, index and value off the stack and stores the value in the array.
member.param: The element type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.StoreArrayElement(Jurassic.Compiler.PrimitiveType)
member.summary: Pops the array, index and value off the stack and stores the value in the array.
member.param: The element type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.LoadArrayLength
member.summary: Pops an array off the stack and pushes the length of the array onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Throw
member.summary: Pops an exception object off the stack and throws the exception.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Rethrow
member.summary: Re-throws the current exception.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BeginExceptionBlock
member.summary: Begins a try-catch-finally block. After issuing this instruction any following instructions are conceptually within the try block.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.EndExceptionBlock
member.summary: Ends a try-catch-finally block.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BeginCatchBlock(System.Type)
member.summary: Begins a catch block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.
member.param: The type of exception to handle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BeginFinallyBlock
member.summary: Begins a finally block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BeginFilterBlock
member.summary: Begins a filter block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.BeginFaultBlock
member.summary: Begins a fault block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Leave(Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)
member.summary: Unconditionally branches to the given label. Unlike the regular branch instruction, this instruction can exit out of try, filter and catch blocks.
member.param: The label to branch to.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.EndFinally
member.summary: This instruction can be used from within a finally block to resume the exception handling process. It is the only valid way of leaving a finally block.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.EndFault
member.summary: This instruction can be used from within a fault block to resume the exception handling process. It is the only valid way of leaving a fault block.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.EndFilter
member.summary: This instruction can be used from within a filter block to indicate whether the exception will be handled. It pops an integer from the stack which should be 0 to continue searching for an exception handler or 1 to use the handler associated with the filter. EndFilter() must be called at the end of a filter block.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator.Breakpoint
member.summary: Triggers a breakpoint in an attached debugger.

member.summary: Marks a sequence point in the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream.
member.param: The document for which the sequence point is being defined.

The column in the line where the sequence point begins.
The line where the sequence point ends.
The column in the line where the sequence point ends.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.BranchIfGreaterThanOrEqualUnsigned(Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)
member.summary: Branches to the given label if the first value on the stack is greater than or equal to the second value on the stack. If the operands are integers then they are treated as if they are unsigned. If the operands are floating point numbers then a NaN value will trigger a branch.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.BranchIfLessThanOrEqual(Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.CompareEqual
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is equal to the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 0 if one or both of the arguments are NaN.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.CompareGreaterThan
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is greater than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 0 if one or both of the arguments are NaN.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.CompareGreaterThanUnsigned
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is greater than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 1 if one or both of the arguments are NaN. Integers are considered to be unsigned.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.CompareLessThan
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is less than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 0 if one or both of the arguments are NaN.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.CompareLessThanUnsigned
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is less than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 1 if one or both of the arguments are NaN. Integers are considered to be unsigned.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.Add
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, adds them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.Subtract
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, subtracts the second from the first, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.Multiply
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, multiplies them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.Divide
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, divides the first by the second, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.Remainder
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, divides the first by the second, then pushes the remainder to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.Negate
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, negates it, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.BitwiseAnd
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, ANDs them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.BitwiseOr
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, ORs them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.BitwiseXor
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, XORs them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.BitwiseNot
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, inverts it, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.ShiftLeft
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, shifts the first to the left, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.ShiftRight
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, shifts the first to the right, then pushes the result to the stack. The sign bit is preserved.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.ShiftRightUnsigned
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, shifts the first to the right, then pushes the result to the stack. The sign bit is not preserved.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.Box(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to an object reference, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.Unbox(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object reference (representing a boxed value) from the stack, extracts the address, then pushes that address onto the stack.
member.param: The type of the boxed value. This should be a value type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.UnboxAny(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object reference (representing a boxed value) from the stack, extracts the value, then pushes the value onto the stack.
member.param: The type of the boxed value. This should be a value type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.ConvertToInteger
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to a signed integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.ConvertToUnsignedInteger
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to an unsigned integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.ConvertToInt64
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to a signed 64-bit integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.ConvertToUnsignedInt64
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to an unsigned 64-bit integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.ConvertToDouble
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to a double, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.ConvertUnsignedToDouble
member.summary: Pops an unsigned integer from the stack, converts it to a double, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.NewObject(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo)
member.summary: Pops the constructor arguments off the stack and creates a new instance of the object.
member.param: The constructor that is used to initialize the object.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.CallStatic(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pops the method arguments off the stack, calls the given method, then pushes the result to the stack (if there was one). This operation can be used to call instance methods, but virtual overrides will not be called and a null check will not be performed at the callsite.
member.param: The method to call.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.CallVirtual(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pops the method arguments off the stack, calls the given method, then pushes the result to the stack (if there was one). This operation cannot be used to call static methods. Virtual overrides are obeyed and a null check is performed.
member.param: The method to call.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.LoadField(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Pushes the value of the given field onto the stack.
member.param: The field whose value will be pushed.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.StoreField(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Pops a value off the stack and stores it in the given field.
member.param: The field to modify.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.CastClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object off the stack, checks that the object inherits from or implements the given type, and pushes the object onto the stack if the check was successful or throws an InvalidCastException if the check failed.
member.param: The type of the class the object inherits from or the interface the object implements.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.IsInstance(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object off the stack, checks that the object inherits from or implements the given type, and pushes either the object (if the check was successful) or null (if the check failed) onto the stack.
member.param: The type of the class the object inherits from or the interface the object implements.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.LoadToken(System.Type)
member.summary: Pushes a RuntimeTypeHandle corresponding to the given type onto the evaluation stack.
member.param: The type to convert to a RuntimeTypeHandle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.LoadToken(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pushes a RuntimeMethodHandle corresponding to the given method onto the evaluation stack.
member.param: The method to convert to a RuntimeMethodHandle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.LoadToken(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Pushes a RuntimeFieldHandle corresponding to the given field onto the evaluation stack.
member.param: The type to convert to a RuntimeFieldHandle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.LoadStaticMethodPointer(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pushes a pointer to the native code implementing the given method onto the evaluation stack. The virtual qualifier will be ignored, if present.
member.param: The method to retrieve a pointer for.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.LoadVirtualMethodPointer(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pushes a pointer to the native code implementing the given method onto the evaluation stack. This method cannot be used to retrieve a pointer to a static method.
member.param: The method to retrieve a pointer for.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.InitObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops a managed or native pointer off the stack and initializes the referenced type with zeros.
member.param: The type the pointer on the top of the stack is pointing to.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.NewArray(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops the size of the array off the stack and pushes a new array of the given type onto the stack.
member.param: The element type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.LoadArrayElement(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops the array and index off the stack and pushes the element value onto the stack.
member.param: The element type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.StoreArrayElement(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops the array, index and value off the stack and stores the value in the array.
member.param: The element type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.LoadArrayLength
member.summary: Pops an array off the stack and pushes the length of the array onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.Throw
member.summary: Pops an exception object off the stack and throws the exception.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.Rethrow
member.summary: Rethrows the current exception.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.BeginExceptionBlock
member.summary: Begins a try-catch-finally block. After issuing this instruction any following instructions are conceptually within the try block.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.EndExceptionBlock
member.summary: Ends a try-catch-finally block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.BeginCatchBlock(System.Type)
member.summary: Begins a catch block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.
member.param: The type of exception to handle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.BeginFinallyBlock
member.summary: Begins a finally block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.BeginFilterBlock
member.summary: Begins a filter block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.BeginFaultBlock
member.summary: Begins a fault block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.Leave(Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)
member.summary: Unconditionally branches to the given label. Unlike the regular branch instruction, this instruction can exit out of try, filter and catch blocks.
member.param: The label to branch to.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.EndFinally
member.summary: This instruction can be used from within a finally block to resume the exception handling process. It is the only valid way of leaving a finally block.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LoggingILGenerator.EndFilter
member.summary: This instruction can be used from within a filter block to indicate whether the exception will be handled. It pops an integer from the stack which should be 0 to continue searching for an exception handler or 1 to use the handler associated with the filter. EndFilter() must be called at the end of a filter block.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.CompareEqual
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is equal to the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 0 if one or both of the arguments are NaN.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.CompareGreaterThan
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is greater than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 0 if one or both of the arguments are NaN.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.CompareGreaterThanUnsigned
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is greater than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 1 if one or both of the arguments are NaN. Integers are considered to be unsigned.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.CompareLessThan
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is less than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 0 if one or both of the arguments are NaN.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.CompareLessThanUnsigned
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, compares, then pushes 1 if the first argument is less than the second, or 0 otherwise. Produces 1 if one or both of the arguments are NaN. Integers are considered to be unsigned.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Add
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, adds them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Subtract
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, subtracts the second from the first, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Multiply
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, multiplies them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Divide
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, divides the first by the second, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Remainder
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, divides the first by the second, then pushes the remainder to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Negate
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, negates it, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.BitwiseAnd
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, ANDs them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.BitwiseOr
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, ORs them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.BitwiseXor
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, XORs them together, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.BitwiseNot
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, inverts it, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.ShiftLeft
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, shifts the first to the left, then pushes the result to the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.ShiftRight
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, shifts the first to the right, then pushes the result to the stack. The sign bit is preserved.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.ShiftRightUnsigned
member.summary: Pops two values from the stack, shifts the first to the right, then pushes the result to the stack. The sign bit is not preserved.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Box(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to an object reference, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Unbox(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object reference (representing a boxed value) from the stack, extracts the address, then pushes that address onto the stack.
member.param: The type of the boxed value. This should be a value type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.UnboxAny(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object reference (representing a boxed value) from the stack, extracts the value, then pushes the value onto the stack.
member.param: The type of the boxed value. This should be a value type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.ConvertToInteger
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to a signed integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.ConvertToUnsignedInteger
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to an unsigned integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.ConvertToInt64
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to a signed 64-bit integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.ConvertToUnsignedInt64
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to an unsigned 64-bit integer, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.ConvertToDouble
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack, converts it to a double, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.ConvertUnsignedToDouble
member.summary: Pops an unsigned integer from the stack, converts it to a double, then pushes it back onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.NewObject(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo)
member.summary: Pops the constructor arguments off the stack and creates a new instance of the object.
member.param: The constructor that is used to initialize the object.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.CallStatic(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pops the method arguments off the stack, calls the given method, then pushes the result to the stack (if there was one). This operation can be used to call instance methods, but virtual overrides will not be called and a null check will not be performed at the callsite.
member.param: The method to call.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.CallVirtual(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pops the method arguments off the stack, calls the given method, then pushes the result to the stack (if there was one). This operation cannot be used to call static methods. Virtual overrides are obeyed and a null check is performed.
member.param: The method to call.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.LoadField(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Pushes the value of the given field onto the stack.
member.param: The field whose value will be pushed.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.StoreField(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Pops a value off the stack and stores it in the given field.
member.param: The field to modify.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.CastClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object off the stack, checks that the object inherits from or implements the given type, and pushes the object onto the stack if the check was successful or throws an InvalidCastException if the check failed.
member.param: The type of the class the object inherits from or the interface the object implements.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.IsInstance(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops an object off the stack, checks that the object inherits from or implements the given type, and pushes either the object (if the check was successful) or null (if the check failed) onto the stack.
member.param: The type of the class the object inherits from or the interface the object implements.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.LoadToken(System.Type)
member.summary: Pushes a RuntimeTypeHandle corresponding to the given type onto the evaluation stack.
member.param: The type to convert to a RuntimeTypeHandle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.LoadToken(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pushes a RuntimeMethodHandle corresponding to the given method onto the evaluation stack.
member.param: The method to convert to a RuntimeMethodHandle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.LoadToken(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Pushes a RuntimeFieldHandle corresponding to the given field onto the evaluation stack.
member.param: The type to convert to a RuntimeFieldHandle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.LoadStaticMethodPointer(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pushes a pointer to the native code implementing the given method onto the evaluation stack. The virtual qualifier will be ignored, if present.
member.param: The method to retrieve a pointer for.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.LoadVirtualMethodPointer(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Pushes a pointer to the native code implementing the given method onto the evaluation stack. This method cannot be used to retrieve a pointer to a static method.
member.param: The method to retrieve a pointer for.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.InitObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops a managed or native pointer off the stack and initializes the referenced type with zeros.
member.param: The type the pointer on the top of the stack is pointing to.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.NewArray(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops the size of the array off the stack and pushes a new array of the given type onto the stack.
member.param: The element type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.LoadArrayElement(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops the array and index off the stack and pushes the element value onto the stack.
member.param: The element type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.StoreArrayElement(System.Type)
member.summary: Pops the array, index and value off the stack and stores the value in the array.
member.param: The element type.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.LoadArrayLength
member.summary: Pops an array off the stack and pushes the length of the array onto the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Throw
member.summary: Pops an exception object off the stack and throws the exception.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Rethrow
member.summary: Rethrows the current exception.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.BeginExceptionBlock
member.summary: Begins a try-catch-finally block. After issuing this instruction any following instructions are conceptually within the try block.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.EndExceptionBlock
member.summary: Ends a try-catch-finally block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.BeginCatchBlock(System.Type)
member.summary: Begins a catch block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.
member.param: The type of exception to handle.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.BeginFinallyBlock
member.summary: Begins a finally block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.BeginFilterBlock
member.summary: Begins a filter block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.BeginFaultBlock
member.summary: Begins a fault block. BeginExceptionBlock() must have already been called.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Leave(Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)
member.summary: Unconditionally branches to the given label. Unlike the regular branch instruction, this instruction can exit out of try, filter and catch blocks.
member.param: The label to branch to.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.EndFinally
member.summary: This instruction can be used from within a finally block to resume the exception handling process. It is the only valid way of leaving a finally block.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.EndFilter
member.summary: This instruction can be used from within a filter block to indicate whether the exception will be handled. It pops an integer from the stack which should be 0 to continue searching for an exception handler or 1 to use the handler associated with the filter. EndFilter() must be called at the end of a filter block.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.Breakpoint
member.summary: Triggers a breakpoint in an attached debugger.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.MarkSequencePoint(System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.ISymbolDocumentWriter,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Marks a sequence point in the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream.
member.param: The document for which the sequence point is being defined.
The line where the sequence point begins.
The column in the line where the sequence point begins.
The line where the sequence point ends.
The column in the line where the sequence point ends.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.ReflectionEmitILGenerator.NoOperation
member.summary: Does nothing.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Compiler.LongJumpException
member.summary: Used internally to allow branching out of a finally block.
member.remarks: This class is only public for technical reasons. It is not intended for use by client code.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.LongJumpException.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new LongJumpException instance.
member.param: The route ID.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.LongJumpException.RouteID
member.summary: Gets the route ID.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Compiler.MethodOptimizationHints
member.summary: Represents information useful for optimizing a method.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.MethodOptimizationHints.EncounteredVariable(System.String)
member.summary: Called by the parser whenever a variable is encountered (variable being any identifier which is not a property name).
member.param: The variable name.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.MethodOptimizationHints.HasVariable(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the parser encountered the given variable name while parsing the function, or if the function contains a reference to "eval" or the function contains nested functions which may reference the variable.
member.param: The variable name.
member.returns: true if the parser encountered the given variable name or "eval" while parsing the function; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.MethodOptimizationHints.HasArguments
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the function being generated contains a reference to the arguments object.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.MethodOptimizationHints.HasEval
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the function being generated contains an eval statement.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.MethodOptimizationHints.CacheResults
member.summary: Caches the HasEval and HasArguments property access.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.MethodOptimizationHints.HasNestedFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the function being generated contains a nested function declaration or expression.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.MethodOptimizationHints.HasThis
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the function being generated contains a reference to the "this" keyword.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo
member.summary: Represents information about one or more code generation optimizations.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new OptimizationInfo instance.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.AbstractSyntaxTree
member.summary: Gets or sets the root of the abstract syntax tree that is being compiled.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.StrictMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether strict mode is enabled.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.DebugDocument
member.summary: Gets or sets the symbol store to write debugging information to.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the source of javascript code.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.FunctionName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the function that is being generated.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.SourceSpan
member.summary: Gets the portion of source code associated with the statement that code is being generated for.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.MarkSequencePoint(Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator,Jurassic.Compiler.SourceCodeSpan)
member.summary: Emits a sequence point, and sets the SourceSpan property.
member.param: The IL generator used to emit the sequence point.
The source code span.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.NestedFunctions
member.summary: Gets a list of generated methods that correspond to nested functions. This list is maintained so that the garbage collector does not prematurely collect the generated code for the nested functions.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.MethodOptimizationHints
member.summary: Gets or sets function optimization information.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.OptimizeDeclarativeScopes
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the declarative scopes should be optimized away, so that the scope is not even created at runtime.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.OptimizeInferredTypes
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the variables should be optimized if the type of the variable can be inferred.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.EvalResult
member.summary: Gets or sets the local variable to store the result of the eval() call. Will be null if code is being generated outside an eval context.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.GetGlobalPropertyReferenceVariable(Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a variable that can be used to store a property name referencing a global variable.
member.param: The IL generator used to create the variable.
The name of the global variable.
member.returns: A variable.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.GetPropertyReferenceVariable(Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a variable that can be used to store a property name referencing an object property.
member.param: The IL generator used to create the variable.
The name of the property.
member.returns: A variable.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.GetRegExpVariable(Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator,Jurassic.Compiler.RegularExpressionLiteral)
member.summary: Retrieves a variable that can be used to store a shared instance of a regular expression.
member.param: The IL generator used to create the variable.
The regular expression literal.
member.returns: A varaible that can be used to store a shared instance of a regular expression.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.ReturnTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets the label the return statement should jump to (with the return value on top of the stack). Will be null if code is being generated outside a function context.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.ReturnVariable
member.summary: Gets or sets the variable that holds the return value for the function. Will be null if code is being generated outside a function context or if no return statements have been encountered.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.InsideLoop
member.summary: Indicates whether we are generating code inside a loop.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.PushBreakOrContinueInfo(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String},Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel,Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pushes information about break or continue targets to a stack.
member.param: The label names associated with the break or continue target. Can be null.
The IL label to jump to if a break statement is encountered.
The IL label to jump to if a continue statement is encountered. Can be null.
true if break or continue statements without a label should ignore this entry; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.PopBreakOrContinueInfo
member.summary: Removes the top-most break or continue information from the stack.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.GetBreakTarget(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the break target for the statement with the given label, if one is provided, or the top-most break target otherwise.
member.param: The label associated with the break target. Can be null.
member.returns: The break target for the statement with the given label.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.GetContinueTarget(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the continue target for the statement with the given label, if one is provided, or the top-most continue target otherwise.
member.param: The label associated with the continue target. Can be null.
member.returns: The continue target for the statement with the given label.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.BreakOrContinueStackSize
member.summary: Gets the number of available break or continue targets. Used to support break or continue statements within finally blocks.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.GetBreakOrContinueLabelDepth(Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)
member.summary: Searches for the given label in the break/continue stack.
member.returns: The depth of the label in the stack. Zero indicates the bottom of the stack. -1 is returned if the label was not found.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.InsideTryCatchOrFinally
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether code generation is occurring within a try, catch or finally block.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.LongJumpCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate that is called when EmitLongJump() is called and the target label is outside the LongJumpStackSizeThreshold.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.LongJumpStackSizeThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the depth of the break/continue stack at the start of the finally statement.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.OptimizationInfo.EmitLongJump(Jurassic.Compiler.ILGenerator,Jurassic.Compiler.ILLabel)
member.summary: Emits code to branch between statements, even if code generation is within a finally block (where unconditional branches are not allowed).
member.param: The generator to output the CIL to.
The label to jump to.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Compiler.TemplateLiteralToken
member.summary:
Represents the text content of a template literal.
Example 1: `plain text` 1. TemplateLiteralToken (Value = "plain text")
Example 2: `${count}` 1. TemplateLiteralToken (Value = "") 2. IdentifierToken (Name = "count") 3. PunctuatorToken (Text = "}") 4. TemplateLiteralToken (Value = "")
Example 3: `Bought ${count} items from ${person}!` 1. TemplateLiteralToken (Value = "Bought ") 2. IdentifierToken (Name = "count") 3. PunctuatorToken (Text = "}") 4. TemplateLiteralToken (Value = " items from ") 5. IdentifierToken (Name = "person") 6. PunctuatorToken (Text = "}") 7. TemplateLiteralToken (Value = "!")

member.name: M:Jurassic.Compiler.TemplateLiteralToken.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new TemplateLiteralToken instance.
member.param: The literal text.
The contents of the template literal, without any escaping.
Indicates whether a substitution follows this string.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.TemplateLiteralToken.SubstitutionFollows
member.summary: Indicates whether a substitution follows this string. For example, this is true for the "hello" in `hello${1}world`, but not the "world".

member.summary: The raw text, prior to performing any escape sequence processing.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Compiler.TemplateLiteralToken.Value
member.summary: Gets the contents of the template string literal.

member.name: T:Jurassic.CompatibilityMode
member.summary: Used to indicate that the script engine should run in compatibility mode.

member.name: F:Jurassic.CompatibilityMode.Latest
member.summary: Indicates that the script engine should run in the most standards compliant mode.

member.name: F:Jurassic.CompatibilityMode.ECMAScript3
member.summary: Indicates that the script engine should conform to the ECMAScript 3 specification. This has the following effects: 1. "this" is converted to an object at the call site of function calls. 2. parseInt() parses octal numbers without requiring an explicit radix. 3. NaN, undefined and Infinity can be modified. 4. The list of keywords is much longer (for example, 'abstract' is a keyword).

member.name: T:Jurassic.ConcatenatedString
member.summary: Represents a string that supports efficient concatenation. This class is used instead of when two strings are concatenated together using the addition operator (+) or the concat() function. Use of this class avoids the creation of useless intermediary strings and by doing so speeds up string concatenation dramatically (this change improved sunspider/string-validate-input.js by almost 20x).

member.name: T:Jurassic.NumberFormatter
member.summary: Converts numbers into strings.

member.name: T:Jurassic.NumberFormatter.Style
member.summary: Used to specify the type of number formatting that should be applied.

member.name: F:Jurassic.NumberFormatter.Style.Regular
member.summary: Specifies that the shortest number that accurately represents the number should be displayed. Scientific notation is used if the exponent is less than -6 or greater than twenty. The precision parameter has no semantic meaning.

member.name: F:Jurassic.NumberFormatter.Style.Precision
member.summary: Specifies that a fixed number of significant figures should be displayed (specified by the precision parameter). If the number cannot be displayed using the given number of digits, scientific notation is used.

member.name: F:Jurassic.NumberFormatter.Style.Fixed
member.summary: Specifies that a fixed number of digits should be displayed after the decimal place (specified by the precision parameter). Scientific notation is used if the exponent is greater than twenty.

member.name: F:Jurassic.NumberFormatter.Style.Exponential
member.summary: Specifies that numbers should always be displayed in scientific notation. The precision parameter specifies the number of figures to display after the decimal point.

member.name: M:Jurassic.NumberFormatter.ToString(System.Double,System.Int32,Jurassic.NumberFormatter.Style,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a number to a string.
member.param: The value to convert to a string.
The base of the number system to convert to.
The type of formatting to apply.

This value is dependent on the formatting style: Regular - this value has no meaning. Precision - the number of significant figures to display. Fixed - the number of figures to display after the decimal point. Exponential - the number of figures to display after the decimal point.

member.name: M:Jurassic.NumberFormatter.ToString(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo,Jurassic.NumberFormatter.Style,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a number to a string.
member.param: The value to convert to a string.
The base of the number system to convert to.
The number format style to use.
The type of formatting to apply.

This value is dependent on the formatting style: Regular - this value has no meaning. Precision - the number of significant figures to display. Fixed - the number of figures to display after the decimal point. Exponential - the number of figures to display after the decimal point.

member.name: M:Jurassic.NumberFormatter.CalculateError(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the minimum increment that creates a number distinct from the value that was provided. The error for the number is plus or minus half the result of this method (note that the number returned by this method may be so small that dividing it by two produces zero).
member.param: The number to calculate an error value for.
member.returns: The minimum increment that creates a number distinct from the value that was provided.

The multiplier.
The power of two scale factor.
member.returns: A BigInteger containing the result of multiplying by and then shifting left by bits.

member.summary: Counts the number of trailing zero bits in the given 64-bit value.

10 for base-10.
member.returns: The logarithm of the provided value, rounded down to the nearest integer.

member.summary: Get or sets a value that indicates the maximum recursion depth of user-defined functions that is allowed by this script engine. When a user-defined function exceeds the recursion depth limit, a will be thrown. The default value is 0, which allows unlimited recursion.

member.name: P:Jurassic.ScriptEngine.EnableDebugging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which indicates whether debug information should be generated. If this is set to true performance and memory usage are negatively impacted.

member.name: P:Jurassic.ScriptEngine.EnableExposedClrTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets whether CLR types can be exposed directly to the script engine. If this is set to false, attempting to instantiate CLR types from script may result in exceptions being thrown in script.

remarks.para: This property is intended to prevent script developers from accessing the entire CLR type system, for security purposes. When this property is set to false, it should prevent new instances of CLR types from being exposed to the script engine, even if you have already exposed CLR types to the script engine.

A user-defined function that is called for each element in the array. This function is called with three arguments: the value of the element, the index of the element, and the array that is being operated on.
The value of this in the context of the callback function.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ArrayInstance.Map(Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance,Jurassic.Library.FunctionInstance,Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance)
member.summary: Creates a new array with the results of calling the given function on every element in this array.
member.param: The array that is being operated on.

A user-defined function that is called for each element in the array. This function is called with three arguments: the value of the element, the index of the element, and the array that is being operated on. The value that is returned from this function is stored in the resulting array.
The value of this in the context of the callback function.
member.returns: A new array with the results of calling the given function on every element in the array.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ArrayInstance.Find(Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance,Jurassic.Library.FunctionInstance,Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance)
member.summary: Returns the first element in the given array that passes the test implemented by the given function.
member.param: The array that is being operated on.

A user-defined function that is called for each element in the array. This function is called with three arguments: the value of the element, the index of the element, and the array that is being operated on. The function should return true or false.
The value of this in the context of the callback function.
member.returns: The first element that results in the callback returning true.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ArrayInstance.Filter(Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance,Jurassic.Library.FunctionInstance,Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance)
member.summary: Creates a new array with the elements from this array that pass the test implemented by the given function.
member.param: The array that is being operated on.

A user-defined function that is called for each element in the array. This function is called with three arguments: the value of the element, the index of the element, and the array that is being operated on. The function should return true or false.
The value of this in the context of the callback function.
member.returns: A copy of this array but with only those elements which produce true when passed to the provided function.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ArrayInstance.Reduce(Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance,Jurassic.Library.FunctionInstance,System.Object)
member.summary: Accumulates a single value by calling a user-defined function for each element.
member.param: The array that is being operated on.

A user-defined function that is called for each element in the array. This function is called with four arguments: the current accumulated value, the value of the element, the index of the element, and the array that is being operated on. The return value for this function is the new accumulated value and is passed to the next invocation of the function.
The initial accumulated value.
member.returns: The accumulated value returned from the last invocation of the callback function.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ArrayInstance.ReduceRight(Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance,Jurassic.Library.FunctionInstance,System.Object)
member.summary: Accumulates a single value by calling a user-defined function for each element (starting with the last element in the array).
member.param: The array that is being operated on.

A user-defined function that is called for each element in the array. This function is called with four arguments: the current accumulated value, the value of the element, the index of the element, and the array that is being operated on. The return value for this function is the new accumulated value and is passed to the next invocation of the function.
The initial accumulated value.
member.returns: The accumulated value returned from the last invocation of the callback function.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ArrayInstance.CopyWithin(Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the sequence of array elements within the array to the position starting at target. The copy is taken from the index positions of the second and third arguments start and end. The end argument is optional and defaults to the length of the array. This method has the same algorithm as Array.prototype.copyWithin.
member.param: The array that is being operated on.
Target start index position where to copy the elements to.
Source start index position where to start copying elements from.
Optional. Source end index position where to end copying elements from.
member.returns: The array that is being operated on.

member.param: The array that is being operated on.
The value to fill the typed array with.

Optional. End index (exclusive). Defaults to the length of the array.
member.returns: The array that is being operated on.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.DateConstructor.Construct(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new Date object from various date components, expressed in local time.
member.param: The full year.
The month as an integer between 0 and 11 (january to december).
The day of the month, from 1 to 31. Defaults to 1.
The number of hours since midnight, from 0 to 23. Defaults to 0.
The number of minutes, from 0 to 59. Defaults to 0.
The number of seconds, from 0 to 59. Defaults to 0.
The number of milliseconds, from 0 to 999. Defaults to 0.
member.remarks: If any of the parameters are out of range, then the other values are modified accordingly.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.DateConstructor.Construct(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a new Date object from various date components, expressed in local time.
member.param: An array containing date components, in the following order: year, month, day, hour, minute, second and millisecond.
member.remarks: If any of the parameters are out of range, then the other values are modified accordingly.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.DateConstructor.Now
member.summary: Returns the current date and time as the number of milliseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.
member.returns: The current date and time as the number of milliseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.DateConstructor.UTC(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Given the components of a UTC date, returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC to that date.
member.param: The full year.
The month as an integer between 0 and 11 (january to december).
The day of the month, from 1 to 31. Defaults to 1.
The number of hours since midnight, from 0 to 23. Defaults to 0.
The number of minutes, from 0 to 59. Defaults to 0.
The number of seconds, from 0 to 59. Defaults to 0.
The number of milliseconds, from 0 to 999. Defaults to 0.
member.returns: The number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC to the given date.
member.remarks:
This method differs from the Date constructor in two ways: 1. The date components are specified in UTC time rather than local time. 2. A number is returned instead of a Date instance.
If any of the parameters are out of range, then the other values are modified accordingly.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.DateInstance.UTC(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Given the components of a UTC date, returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC to that date.
member.param: The full year.
The month as an integer between 0 and 11 (january to december).
The day of the month, from 1 to 31. Defaults to 1.
The number of hours since midnight, from 0 to 23. Defaults to 0.
The number of minutes, from 0 to 59. Defaults to 0.
The number of seconds, from 0 to 59. Defaults to 0.
The number of milliseconds, from 0 to 999. Defaults to 0.
member.returns: The number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC to the given date.
member.remarks:
This method differs from the Date constructor in two ways: 1. The date components are specified in UTC time rather than local time. 2. A number is returned instead of a Date instance.
If any of the parameters are out of range, then the other values are modified accordingly.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Library.ErrorConstructor
member.summary: Represents a constructor for one of the error types: Error, RangeError, SyntaxError, etc.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ErrorConstructor.#ctor(Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance,Jurassic.Library.ErrorType)
member.summary: Creates a new derived error function.
member.param: The next object in the prototype chain.
The type of error, e.g. Error, RangeError, etc.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ErrorConstructor.Call(System.String)
member.summary: Called when the Error object is invoked like a function, e.g. var x = Error("oh no"). Creates a new derived error instance with the given message.
member.param: A description of the error.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ErrorConstructor.Construct(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new derived error instance with the given message.
member.param: A description of the error.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance
member.summary: Represents the base class of all the javascript errors.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance.#ctor(Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Error instance with the given message.
member.param: The next object in the prototype chain.
The initial value of the message property. Pass null to avoid creating this property.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance.CreatePrototype(Jurassic.ScriptEngine,Jurassic.Library.ErrorConstructor,Jurassic.Library.ErrorType)
member.summary: Creates the Error prototype object.
member.param: The script environment.
A reference to the constructor that owns the prototype.
The type of error, e.g. Error, RangeError, etc.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance.GetPrototype(Jurassic.ScriptEngine,Jurassic.Library.ErrorType)
member.summary: Determine the prototype for the given error type.
member.param: The script engine associated with this object.
The type of error, e.g. Error, RangeError, etc.
member.returns: The prototype.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance.Name
member.summary: Gets the name for the type of error.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance.Message
member.summary: Gets a human-readable description of the error.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance.Stack
member.summary: Gets the stack trace. Note that this is populated when the object is thrown, NOT when it is initialized.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance.SetStackTrace(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the stack trace information.
member.param: The path of the javascript source file that is currently executing.
The name of the currently executing function.
The line number of the statement that is currently executing.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance.ToString(Jurassic.ScriptEngine,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a string representing the current object.
member.param: The current script environment.
The object that is being operated on.
member.returns: A string representing the current object.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance.DebuggerDisplayValue
member.summary: Gets an enumerable list of every property name and value associated with this object. Does not include properties in the prototype chain.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance.DebuggerDisplayShortValue
member.summary: Gets value, that will be displayed in debugger watch window.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.ErrorInstance.DebuggerDisplayType
member.summary: Gets value, that will be displayed in debugger watch window when this object is part of array, map, etc.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Library.ErrorType
member.summary: Used when creating an error to specify the specific type of error.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.ErrorType.Error
member.summary: Represents a generic error.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.ErrorType.RangeError
member.summary: Indicates a value that is not in the set or range of allowable values.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.ErrorType.TypeError
member.summary: Indicates the actual type of an operand is different than the expected type.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.ErrorType.SyntaxError
member.summary: Indicates that a parsing error has occurred.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.ErrorType.URIError
member.summary: Indicates that one of the global URI handling functions was used in a way that is incompatible with its definition.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.ErrorType.EvalError
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.ErrorType.ReferenceError
member.summary: Indicate that an invalid reference value has been detected.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole
member.summary: Represents a set of commands for working with the standard console. This class is non-standard - it is based on the Firebug console API (http://getfirebug.com/wiki/index.php/Console_API).

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.#ctor(Jurassic.ScriptEngine)
member.summary: Creates a new FirebugConsole instance.
member.param: The associated script engine.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Output
member.summary: Gets or sets the console to output to.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.DebuggerDisplayValue
member.summary: Gets an enumerable list of every property name and value associated with this object. Does not include properties in the prototype chain.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.DebuggerDisplayShortValue
member.summary: Gets value, that will be displayed in debugger watch window.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.DebuggerDisplayType
member.summary: Gets value, that will be displayed in debugger watch window when this object is part of array, map, etc.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Log(System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs a message to the console. The objects provided will be converted to strings then joined together in a space separated line. The first parameter can be a string containing the following patterns: %s String %d, %i Integer %f Floating point number
member.param: The items to format.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Debug(System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs a message to the console. The objects provided will be converted to strings then joined together in a space separated line. The first parameter can be a string containing the following patterns: %s String %d, %i Integer %f Floating point number
member.param: The items to format.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Info(System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs a message to the console using a style suggesting informational content. The objects provided will be converted to strings then joined together in a space separated line. The first parameter can be a string containing the following patterns: %s String %d, %i Integer %f Floating point number
member.param: The items to format.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Warn(System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs a message to the console using a style suggesting a warning. The objects provided will be converted to strings then joined together in a space separated line. The first parameter can be a string containing the following patterns: %s String %d, %i Integer %f Floating point number
member.param: The items to format.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Error(System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs a message to the console using a style suggesting an error. The objects provided will be converted to strings then joined together in a space separated line. The first parameter can be a string containing the following patterns: %s String %d, %i Integer %f Floating point number
member.param: The items to format.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Assert(System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary: Tests that an expression is true. If not, it will write a message to the console.
member.param: The expression to test.
The items to format.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Clear(System.Object[])
member.summary: Clears the console.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Group(System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a message to the console and opens a nested block to indent all future messages sent to the console. Call console.groupEnd() to close the block.
member.param: The items to format.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.GroupCollapsed(System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a message to the console and opens a nested block to indent all future messages sent to the console. Call console.groupEnd() to close the block.
member.param: The items to format.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.GroupEnd
member.summary: Closes the most recently opened block created by a call to console.group().

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Time(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new timer under the given name. Call console.timeEnd(name) with the same name to stop the timer and print the time elapsed.
member.param: The name of the time to create.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.TimeEnd(System.String)
member.summary: Stops a timer created by a call to console.time(name) and writes the time elapsed.
member.param: The name of the timer to stop.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Log(Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsoleMessageStyle,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs a message to the console. The objects provided will be converted to strings then joined together in a space separated line. The first parameter can be a string containing the following patterns: %s String %d, %i Integer %f Floating point number
member.param: The style of the message (this determines the icon and text color).
The items to format.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.FirebugConsole.Format(System.Object[])

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.MathObject.Random
member.summary: Returns a pseudorandom number between 0 and 1.
member.returns: A pseudorandom number between 0 and 1. The pseudorandom number generated is from 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive), that is, the returned number can be zero, but it will always be less than one. The random number generator is seeded automatically.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.MathObject.Round(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the value of a number rounded to the nearest integer.
member.param: The number to operate on.
member.returns: The required number argument is the value to be rounded to the nearest integer. For positive numbers, if the decimal portion of number is 0.5 or greater, the return value is equal to the smallest integer greater than number. If the decimal portion is less than 0.5, the return value is the largest integer less than or equal to number. For negative numbers, if the decimal portion is exactly -0.5, the return value is the smallest integer that is greater than the number. For example, Math.round(8.5) returns 9, but Math.round(-8.5) returns -8.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.MathObject.Sin(System.Double)

member.returns: The sine of the parameter (between -1 and 1).

member.returns: The square root of the parameter.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.MathObject.Tan(System.Double)

member.param: The angle, in radians.
