member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.NumberConstructor.ParseInt(Jurassic.ScriptEngine,System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Parses the given string and returns the equivalent integer value.
member.param: The associated script engine.
The string to parse.

The numeric base to use for parsing. Pass zero to use base 10 except when the input string starts with '0' in which case base 16 or base 8 are used instead (base 8 is only supported in compatibility mode).
member.returns: The equivalent integer value of the given string.
member.remarks: Leading whitespace is ignored. Parsing continues until the first invalid character, at which point parsing stops. No error is returned in this case.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.NumberConstructor.ParseFloat(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the given string and returns the equivalent numeric value.

member.returns: The equivalent numeric value of the given string.
member.remarks: Leading whitespace is ignored. Parsing continues until the first invalid character, at which point parsing stops. No error is returned in this case.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.NumberInstance.ToExponential(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a string representing a number represented in exponential notation.
member.param: Number of digits after the decimal point. Must be in the range 0 – 20, inclusive. Defaults to the number of digits necessary to specify the number.
member.returns: A string representation of a number in exponential notation. The string contains one digit before the significand's decimal point, and may contain fractionDigits digits after it.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.NumberInstance.ToFixed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a string representing a number in fixed-point notation.
member.param: Number of digits after the decimal point. Must be in the range 0 – 20, inclusive.
member.returns: A string representation of a number in fixed-point notation. The string contains one digit before the significand's decimal point, and must contain fractionDigits digits after it. If fractionDigits is not supplied or undefined, the toFixed method assumes the value is zero.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.NumberInstance.ToLocaleString
member.summary: Returns a string containing a locale-dependant version of the number.
member.returns: A string containing a locale-dependant version of the number.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.NumberInstance.ToPrecision(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a string containing a number represented either in exponential or fixed-point notation with a specified number of digits.
member.param: The number of significant digits. Must be in the range 1 – 21, inclusive.
member.returns: A string containing a number represented either in exponential or fixed-point notation with a specified number of digits.
member.remarks: For numbers in exponential notation, precision - 1 digits are returned after the decimal point. For numbers in fixed notation, precision significant digits are returned. If precision is not supplied or is undefined, the toString method is called instead.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.NumberInstance.ToStringJS(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the textual representation of the number.

member.returns: The textual representation of the number.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the property should be enumerable (exposed via the for...in construct) in JavaScript code. The default value of this property is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the property should be configurable, that is, whether the property may be changed or have its descriptor changed by JavaScript code. The default value of this property is true.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.JSInternalFunctionAttribute.RequiredArgumentCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of parameters that are required. If the function is called with fewer than this number of arguments, then a TypeError will be thrown.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the property should be enumerable (exposed via the for...in construct) in JavaScript code. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Library.JSConstructorFunctionAttribute

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance.SetPropertyValue(System.UInt32,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value of the property with the given array index. If a property with the given index does not exist, or exists in the prototype chain (and is not a setter) then a new property is created.
member.param: The array index of the property to set.
The value to set the property to. This must be a javascript primitive (double, string, etc) or a class derived from .
true to throw an exception if the property could not be set. This can happen if the property is read-only or if the object is sealed.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance.SetPropertyValue(System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value of the property with the given name. If a property with the given name does not exist, or exists in the prototype chain (and is not a setter) then a new property is created.
member.param: The property key of the property to set.
The value to set the property to. This must be a javascript primitive (double, string, etc) or a class derived from .
true to throw an exception if the property could not be set (i.e. if the property is read-only or if the object is not extensible and a new property needs to be created).

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance.SetPropertyValue(Jurassic.Library.PropertyReference,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value of the property with the given name. If a property with the given name does not exist, or exists in the prototype chain (and is not a setter) then a new property is created.
member.param: The name of the property to set.
The value to set the property to. This must be a javascript primitive (double, string, etc) or a class derived from .
true to throw an exception if the property could not be set (i.e. if the property is read-only or if the object is not extensible and a new property needs to be created).

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance.SetPropertyValueIfExists(System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value of the given property. If a property with the given name exists, but only in the prototype chain, then a new property is created (unless the property is a setter, in which case the setter is called and no property is created). If the property does not exist at all, then no property is created and the method returns false. This method is used to set the value of a variable reference within a with statement.
member.param: The property key (either a string or a Symbol). Cannot be an array index.
The desired value of the property. This must be a javascript primitive (double, string, etc) or a class derived from .
true to throw an exception if the property could not be set (i.e. if the property is read-only or if the object is not extensible and a new property needs to be created).
member.returns: true if the property value exists; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance.Delete(System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the property with the given array index.
member.param: The array index of the property to delete.
true to throw an exception if the property could not be set because the property was marked as non-configurable.
member.returns: true if the property was successfully deleted, or if the property did not exist; false if the property was marked as non-configurable and was false.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance.Delete(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the property with the given name.
member.param: The property key of the property to delete.
true to throw an exception if the property could not be set because the property was marked as non-configurable.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance.DefineProperty(System.Object,Jurassic.Library.PropertyDescriptor,System.Boolean)

The property value and attributes.
true to throw an exception if the property could not be set. This can happen if the property is not configurable or the object is sealed.
member.returns: true if the property was successfully modified; false otherwise.

true to throw an exception if the property could not be added (i.e. if the object is not extensible).

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance.FastSetProperty(System.Object,System.Object,Jurassic.Library.PropertyAttributes,System.Boolean)

Attributes that indicate whether the property is writable, configurable and enumerable.
Indicates whether to overwrite any existing attributes.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Library.PropertyAttributes
member.summary: A set of flags which controls the accessibility of properties.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.PropertyAttributes.Sealed
member.summary: Indicates the property value is not writable, enumerable or configurable. This is the default for built-in properties.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.PropertyAttributes.Writable
member.summary: Indicates the property value is writable. If this flag is not set, attempting to modify the property will fail. Not used if the property is an accessor property.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.PropertyAttributes.Enumerable
member.summary: Indicates the property will be enumerated by a for-in enumeration. Otherwise, the property is said to be non-enumerable.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.PropertyAttributes.Configurable
member.summary: Indicates the property can be deleted or changed to an accessor property or have it's flags changed.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.PropertyAttributes.NonEnumerable
member.summary: Indicates the property can be modified and deleted but will not be enumerated.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.PropertyAttributes.FullAccess
member.summary: Indicates the property is read-write, enumerable and configurable. This is the default for user-created properties.

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.PropertyAttributes.IsAccessorProperty
member.summary: Indicates the property is an accessor property (i.e. it has a getter or a setter).

member.name: F:Jurassic.Library.PropertyAttributes.IsLengthProperty
member.summary: Indicates the property is the "magic" length property (only found on arrays).

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.PromiseConstructor.Resolve(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns either a new promise resolved with the passed argument, or the argument itself if the argument is a promise produced by this constructor.
member.param: Argument to be resolved by this Promise. Can also be a Promise or a thenable to resolve.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.PromiseConstructor.Race(Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance)
member.summary: Returns a new promise which is settled in the same way as the first passed promise to settle. All elements of the passed iterable are resolved to promises.
member.param: An iterable object such as an Array.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.PromiseConstructor.All(Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance)
member.summary: Returns a Promise. It takes one argument: a list of Promises that determine whether the new Promise is fulfilled or rejected.
member.param: An iterable object such as an Array.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Library.PromiseInstance
member.summary: Represents an instance of the Promise object.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.PromiseInstance.#ctor(Jurassic.Library.ObjectInstance)
member.summary: Creates a new Promise instance.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.PromiseInstance.Resolve(System.Object)
member.summary: Resolves the promise with the given value. If the value is an object with a "then" function, the returned promise will "follow" that thenable, adopting its eventual state; otherwise the returned promise will be fulfilled with the value.
member.param: The resolved value of the promise, or a promise or thenable to follow.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.PromiseInstance.Reject(System.Object)
member.summary: Rejects the promise with the given reason.
member.param: The reason why this promise rejected. Can be an Error instance.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.PromiseInstance.CreatePrototype(Jurassic.ScriptEngine,Jurassic.Library.PromiseConstructor)
member.summary: Creates the Promise prototype object.
member.param: The script environment.
A reference to the constructor that owns the prototype.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.PromiseInstance.Finally(System.Object)
member.summary: When the promise is completed, i.e either fulfilled or rejected, the specified callback function is executed.
member.param: A Function called when the Promise is completed.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.PromiseInstance.Catch(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a Promise and deals with rejected cases only. It behaves the same as calling Promise.prototype.then(undefined, onRejected).
member.param: A Function called when the Promise is rejected. This function has one argument, the rejection reason.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.PromiseInstance.Then(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a Promise. It takes two arguments: callback functions for the success and failure cases of the Promise.
member.param: A Function called when the Promise is fulfilled. This function has one argument, the fulfillment value.
A Function called when the Promise is rejected. This function has one argument, the rejection reason.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.PromiseInstance.CreateTask
member.summary: Creates a task that completes when this promise completes.
member.returns: The task that completes when this promise completes.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.RegExpConstructor.Call(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Called when the RegExp object is invoked like a function e.g. RegExp('abc', 'g') or RegExp(/abc/). If a string is passed as the first parameter it creates a new regular expression instance. Otherwise, if a regular expression is passed it returns the given regular expression verbatim.
member.param: A regular expression pattern or a regular expression.
Available flags, which may be combined, are: g (global search for all occurrences of pattern) i (ignore case) m (multiline search)

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.RegExpConstructor.Construct(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Called when the new keyword is used on the RegExp object e.g. new RegExp(/abc/). Creates a new regular expression instance.
member.param: The regular expression pattern, or a regular expression to clone.
Available flags, which may be combined, are: g (global search for all occurrences of pattern) i (ignore case) m (multiline search)

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the global flag is set. If this flag is set it indicates that a search should find all occurrences of the pattern within the searched string, not just the first one.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.RegExpInstance.Multiline
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the multiline flag is set. If this flag is set it indicates that the ^ and $ tokens should match the start and end of lines and not just the start and end of the string.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.RegExpInstance.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the ignoreCase flag is set. If this flag is set it indicates that a search should ignore differences in case between the pattern and the matched string.

member.name: P:Jurassic.Library.RegExpInstance.LastIndex
member.summary: Gets the character position to start searching when the global flag is set.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.RegExpInstance.Compile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compiles the regular expression for faster execution.
member.param: The regular expression pattern.
Available flags, which may be combined, are: g (global search for all occurrences of pattern) i (ignore case) m (multiline search)

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.RegExpInstance.Test(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a boolean value that indicates whether or not a pattern exists in a searched string.
member.param: The string on which to perform the search.
member.returns: true if the regular expression has at least one match in the given string; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.RegExpInstance.Exec(System.String)
member.summary: Executes a search on a string using a regular expression pattern, and returns an array containing the results of that search.
member.param: The string on which to perform the search.
member.returns: Returns an array containing the match and submatch details, or null if no match was found. The array returned by the exec method has three properties, input, index and lastIndex. The input property contains the entire searched string. The index property contains the position of the matched substring within the complete searched string. The lastIndex property contains the position following the last character in the match.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.RegExpInstance.CalculateStartPosition(System.String)
member.summary: Calculates the position to start searching.
member.param: The string on which to perform the search.
member.returns: The character position to start searching.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.RegExpInstance.Match(System.String)
member.summary: Finds all regular expression matches within the given string.
member.param: The string on which to perform the search.
member.returns: An array containing the matched strings.

member.summary: Returns a copy of the given string with text replaced using a regular expression.

member.name: T:Jurassic.Library.ArrayBufferConstructor
member.summary: The ArrayBuffer object is used to represent a generic, fixed-length raw binary data buffer. You can not directly manipulate the contents of an ArrayBuffer; instead, you create one of the typed array objects or a DataView object which represents the buffer in a specific format, and use that to read and write the contents of the buffer.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.ArrayBufferInstance.Slice(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a new ArrayBuffer whose contents are a copy of this ArrayBuffer's bytes from begin, inclusive, up to end, exclusive.
member.param: Zero-based byte index at which to begin slicing.

Byte index to end slicing. If end is unspecified, the new ArrayBuffer contains all bytes from begin to the end of this ArrayBuffer. The range specified by the begin and end values is clamped to the valid index range for the current array. If the computed length of the new ArrayBuffer would be negative, it is clamped to zero.
member.returns: A new ArrayBuffer object.

Source start index position where to start copying elements from.

member.returns: true if every element of the array matches criteria defined by the given user-defined function; false otherwise.

The value that is returned from this function is stored in the resulting array.
The value of this in the context of the callback function.
member.returns: A new array with the results of calling the given function on every element in the array.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.TypedArrayInstance.Reduce(Jurassic.Library.FunctionInstance,System.Object)
member.summary: Accumulates a single value by calling a user-defined function for each element.

This function is called with four arguments: the current accumulated value, the value of the element, the index of the element, and the array that is being operated on. The return value for this function is the new accumulated value and is passed to the next invocation of the function.
The initial accumulated value.
member.returns: The accumulated value returned from the last invocation of the callback function.

The return value for this function is the new accumulated value and is passed to the next invocation of the function.
The initial accumulated value.
member.returns: The accumulated value returned from the last invocation of the callback function.

The offset into the target array at which to begin writing values from the source array. If you omit this value, 0 is assumed (that is, the source array will overwrite values in the target array starting at index 0).

member.summary: Creates a new WeakSet instance.

member.summary: The WeakSet object lets you store weakly held objects in a collection.

member.summary: Creates a new WeakSet instance.
member.param: The next object in the prototype chain.

member.summary: Creates the WeakSet prototype object.

A reference to the constructor that owns the prototype.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.WeakSetInstance.Add(System.Object)
member.summary: Appends a new element with a specified value to the end of the WeakSet.
member.param: The value of the element to add to the WeakSet.
member.returns: The WeakSet object.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.WeakSetInstance.Delete(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the specified value from the WeakSet.
member.param: The value of the element to remove from the WeakSet.
member.returns: true if an element in the WeakSet object has been removed successfully; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Jurassic.Library.WeakSetInstance.Has(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a boolean indicating whether an element with the specified value exists in the WeakSet or not.
member.param: The value to test for presence in the WeakSet.
member.returns: true if an element with the specified value exists in the WeakSet object; otherwise false.
